00001 /* File tree.h
00002  * Contains structure definition for the binary tree.
00003  * Also has prototypes for tree functions.
00004  * @author Tushar Narayan
00005  */
00006 
00007 #ifndef TREE_H
00008 #define TREE_H
00009 
00014 struct treenode {
00015   char* value;
00016   struct treenode *left_child;
00017   struct treenode *right_child;
00018 };
00019 
00020 typedef struct treenode Tnode; // for convenience
00021 
00022 static Tnode* NULL_NODE = (Tnode*) NULL; //constant pointer to a null node
00023 
00024 // Function prototypes
00025 
00026 /* Function add_tnode
00027  * Takes in pointer to an existing node or NULL, and a value.
00028  * If the pointer is NULL, allocates a new node, assigns value,
00029  * and returns pointer to the newly-allocated node.
00030  * If the pointer is not NULL, compares the value to that in the node
00031  * pointed to, and then calls the function on child tree as appropriate.
00032  * If the pointer is not null, just returns 'current_node',
00033  * because it is the root of the subtree,
00034  * Returns current node in case of a duplicate value.
00035  * @param *current_node pointer to existing node (or NULL)
00036  * @param value the string to be added to the node
00037  * @return pointer to newly-allocated node
00038  */
00039 Tnode* add_tnode(Tnode *current_node, char* value);
00040 
00041 /* Function print_descending
00042  * traverses the tree and prints strings in descending order.
00043  * @param current_node pointer to current node (or NULL)
00044  */
00045 void print_descending(Tnode* current_node);
00046 
00047 /*Function free_nodes
00048  * traverses the tree and frees all the nodes.
00049  * @param current_node root node of the tree that has to be freed
00050  */
00051 void free_nodes(Tnode* current_node);
00052 
00053 #endif
